```typescript
function calculateVirtualObjectPosition(objectPosition: p5.Vector, mirror: Mirror): p5.Vector {
  // 1. Get the mirror normal (perpendicular direction)
  const normalX = Math.cos(mirror.angle + Math.PI / 2);
  const normalY = Math.sin(mirror.angle + Math.PI / 2);
  
  // 2. Vector from mirror center to object
  const toObject = objectPosition.copy().sub(mirror.pos);
  
  // 3. Project onto normal to get perpendicular distance
  const perpDistance = toObject.x * normalX + toObject.y * normalY;
  
  // 4. Virtual object is same distance on opposite side
  const virtualPos = objectPosition.copy();
  virtualPos.x -= 2 * perpDistance * normalX;
  virtualPos.y -= 2 * perpDistance * normalY;
  
  return virtualPos;
}
```
